intro: Impatiens diepenhorstii var. brevicornu, commonly known as the dwarf African violet, is a rare and striking plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the Balsaminaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant features heart-shaped, dark green leaves that are velvety to the touch, and its flowers are typically purple or pink with a distinctive spurred petal. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is a sought-after specimen among botanical enthusiasts and conservationists.
